headline: U.S. and France Suspend Hostilities on Tariffs and Taxes
abstract: The détente emerged after Presidents Macron and Trump agreed to grant more time for talks over a global solution to taxing Amazon, Facebook and other digital giants.
lead_paragraph: PARIS — France and the United States appeared to strike a temporary truce in a trans-Atlantic spat, French officials said Tuesday, after President Emmanuel Macron agreed to suspend a tax on American technology giants in exchange for a postponement of threatened retaliatory tariffs on French goods by the Trump administration.
keywords: Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development
